content.raw:
Talking with @chapulina, it shouldn't be problematic because this callback is triggered when there's a new response to a request. The request is fired when the user changes the link in the window dialog. So, it's unlikely that the user could select two links so fast that the response arrives almost at the same time.

That being said, I would use a mutex just in case something funky happens in the background and the transport sends the request twice for example. It's also nice that your code works no matter what happens in the outside.

Talking with @chapulina, it shouldn't be problematic because this callback is triggered when there's a new response to a request. The request is fired when the user changes the link in the window dialog. So, it's unlikely that the user could select two links so fast that the response arrives almost at the same time.

That being said, I would use a mutex just in case something funky happens in the background and the transport sends the request twice for example. It's also nice that your code works no matter what happens in the outside.
